intro: Stenanthus squarrosus, commonly known as the squarrosy stenanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and typically grows in moist, woodland habitats. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring. Its unique floral structure includes two large, showy petals and two smaller, spurred petals. Stenanthus squarrosus is often found in shaded, well-drained soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
